answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat

answers.answer:
Yes, we track our GG round and milestones in Karma: https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/kolektivo-network

GG18,20,21 Climate Round
Real World Builders Round
GG22 Open Source Round
answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer: Our contract, Web App, and Mobile App are all open-source. We continue to build on top of and nurture open-source code and onchain protocols.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer: Our solution allows for the organization of local (impact) activities which can be paid out in local (community) stablecoins accepted in these communities creating a circular economy of onchain impact and payments.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
Our next step is building a local stablecoin in collaboration with Mento and integrating in local fintech solutions to provide a more seamless on-the-ground experience for activity hosts, contributors, impact buyers and merchants. 

This GG23 grant will provide us with resources to progress CGC development
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Kolektivo Network
project.description:
Emerging and developing countries, especially in remote locations, are most affected by environmental degradation and climate change. However, they often lack the resources to take meaningful action, making them entirely dependent on the decisions of other countries.

It is estimated that an annual investment of $5 trillion is needed to combat climate change. Of this figure, emerging and developing countries (EMDEs) need $2 trillion annually, a fivefold increase from 2020 (IMF, 2023).

Without the right infrastructure to coordinate such significant budgets, it's unlikely that EMDEs will be able to attract $2 trillion annually and take the required actions.

Local NGOs, businesses, and individuals in these EMDEs must be included in the solution to increase the socioeconomic support base for such action. Kolektivo allows local stakeholders to leverage their positive impact to start local impact-driven economies that regenerate communities and nature. 

**Progress since GG22**
*  Completed our Web App development and made progress with our Mobile App. 
*   Started the development of CGC, a local stablecoin for Curacao and Sint Maarten.
*   Started Research and Design for a MiniPay-centered Kolektivo solution.

Kolektivo combines a web platform for stakeholders and a mobile app for individuals to create local impact economies based on the positive impact created.

By making the impact created more visible and streamlining the coordination of resources between stakeholders through our platform, we encourage local development. Due to the community currency created in our platform and the ability for users to earn skill badges, the pilot also supports capacity building and financial inclusion.

Impact partners and local businesses can support a local Kolektivo community and, in exchange, receive a visual claim on the impact created by a specific project or niche. The positive PR effects are more significant when supporting local ESG initiatives.

Our primary users are NGO managers who request community currency budgets from the local community to organize impact activities. Users earn community currencies, which they can spend at impact partners and skill points to participate in these activities.
